intro: Plukenetia occidentalis, commonly known as the African breadfruit, is a tropical shrub native to western Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces oval, yellow-orange fruits that are rich in oil and used in traditional medicine and as a source of edible oil. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native region.
